name: Blood count
description: Blood count, laboratory test that determines the number of red blood cells (erythrocytes) and white blood cells (leukocytes) in a given volume of blood.

name: Bone marrow aspiration
description: Bone marrow aspiration, direct removal of a small amount (about 1–5 millilitres) of bone marrow by suction through a hollow needle.

name: Magnetoencephalography
description: Magnetoencephalography (MEG), imaging technique that measures the weak magnetic fields emitted by neurons. An array of cylinder-shaped sensors monitors the magnetic field pattern near the patient’s head to determine the position and strength of activity in various regions of the brain.

name: Immunologic blood test
description: Immunologic blood test, any of a group of diagnostic analyses of blood that employ antigens (foreign proteins) and antibodies (immunoglobulins) to detect abnormalities of the immune system.

name: Liver function test
description: Liver function test, any laboratory procedure that measures and assesses various aspects of liver function.

name: Pregnancy test
description: Pregnancy test, procedure aimed at determining whether a woman is pregnant. Pregnancy tests are based on a detectable increase in human chorionic gonadotropin (HCG) in the blood serum and urine during early pregnancy.

name: Schick test
description: Schick test, method for determining susceptibility to diphtheria; it laid the basis for inoculation against the disease. A minute amount of diphtheria toxin is injected into the skin of the forearm.

name: Cardiac catheterization
description: Cardiac catheterization, medical procedure by which a flexible plastic tube (catheter) is inserted into an artery or vein.
